localised_text.last_approved_text: Tretch Craventail, Grand Chieftain of the Deep Warrens, has been sent far from Clan Rictus' traditional territory in the Dark Lands. The leader of the clan, Lord Doomclaw, has ordered Tretch establish a tail-hold on the shores of Naggaroth, a land steeped in darkness and Warpstone. However, Grey Seer Vulscreek speaks for the Council of Thirteen, and orders much of the precious green stuff collected, for rituals must continue to be cast. The race is on – the Vortex will be claimed by Clan Rictus!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Tretch Craventail, Grand Chieftain of the Deep Warrens, has been sent far from Clan Rictus' traditional territory in the Dark Lands. The leader of the clan, Lord Doomclaw, has ordered Tretch establish a tail-hold on the shores of Naggaroth, a land steeped in darkness and Warpstone. However, Grey Seer Vulscreek speaks for the Council of Thirteen, and orders much of the precious green stuff collected, for rituals must continue to be cast. The race is on – the Vortex will be claimed by Clan Rictus!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Under the orders of Clanlord Kratch Doomclaw, Tretch has been sent to the Clawed Coast, in the cruel Elf-thing realm of Naggaroth. The Grand Chieftain is charged with harvesting the abundant Warpstone deposits found there and establishing a strong tail-hold far from Clan Rictus’ primary lair at Crookback Mountain. It will be a difficult task, but one Tretch is more than capable of, for some whisper that this Skaven must hold the favour of the Horned Rat himself.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Under the orders of Clanlord Kratch Doomclaw, Tretch has been sent to the Clawed Coast, in the cruel Elf-thing realm of Naggaroth. The Grand Chieftain is charged with harvesting the abundant Warpstone deposits found there and establishing a strong tail-hold far from Clan Rictus’ primary lair at Crookback Mountain. It will be a difficult task, but one Tretch is more than capable of, for some whisper that this Skaven must hold the favour of the Horned Rat himself.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Grand Hierophant’s roaming has taken him far from Nehekhara. Khatep and his fellow exiles now find themselves in the cold north, seeking out the tomes of Nagash that will grant ingress to the Black Pyramid, with which he shall restore the Mortuary Cult’s favour with the Great King. Firstly, Khatep must ensure this expedition is not frustrated by the local – living – populace. The Dark Elves look upon Khatep’s arrival as a threat – prove their concerns correct!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The Grand Hierophant’s roaming has taken him far from Nehekhara. Khatep and his fellow exiles now find themselves in the cold north, seeking out the tomes of Nagash that will grant ingress to the Black Pyramid, with which he shall restore the Mortuary Cult’s favour with the Great King. Firstly, Khatep must ensure this expedition is not frustrated by the local – living – populace. The Dark Elves look upon Khatep’s arrival as a threat – prove their concerns correct!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Exiles of Nehek, led by Grand Hierophant Khatep, have stopped roaming for now. They have come across a cache of lost lore deep within the Obsidian Peaks – dark knowledge that may bring about the fabled Day of Awakening. However, Beastmen and Dark Elves seem intent on frustrating such plans. Their annihilation must take priority, and then perhaps the whole world should be silenced… that would surely please the King of Kings?

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The Exiles of Nehek, led by Grand Hierophant Khatep, have stopped roaming for now. They have come across a cache of lost lore deep within the Obsidian Peaks – dark knowledge that may bring about the fabled Day of Awakening. However, Beastmen and Dark Elves seem intent on frustrating such plans. Their annihilation must take priority, and then perhaps the whole world should be silenced… that would surely please the King of Kings?

localised_text.last_approved_text: After centuries of fruitless searching there is at last a sign from the Liche King’s true master. The Black Pyramid stirs – it needs but four of Nagash’s tomes, and the power of his staff, to fully awaken. But Arkhan will not be left alone! Mortal nuisances such as errantry Bretonnians from the north, as well as the Tomb Kings themselves, must all be dealt with before the resurrection can truly begin.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: After centuries of fruitless searching there is at last a sign from the Liche King’s true master. The Black Pyramid stirs – it needs but four of Nagash’s tomes, and the power of his staff, to fully awaken. But Arkhan will not be left alone! Mortal nuisances such as errantry Bretonnians from the north, as well as the Tomb Kings themselves, must all be dealt with before the resurrection can truly begin.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Arkhan the Black has spent millennia searching for the relics left behind by his master, Nagash. The hunt has not been in vain, however, for the time has come to unite these remnants of the Great Necromancer. Yet the resurrection will not be enough – the greatest gift will be a world already succumbed: an empire of Undeath. Best start with these questing Bretonnian irritants!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Arkhan the Black has spent millennia searching for the relics left behind by his master, Nagash. The hunt has not been in vain, however, for the time has come to unite these remnants of the Great Necromancer. Yet the resurrection will not be enough – the greatest gift will be a world already succumbed: an empire of Undeath. Best start with these questing Bretonnian irritants!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The comet has woken the Black Pyramid of the usurper. Now, there is not a moment to lose – find five of Nagash’s tomes so the Liches can claim the power for Settra, King of Kings. First though, there is a Greenskin infestation in the north to deal with…

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The comet has woken the Black Pyramid of the usurper. Now, there is not a moment to lose – find five of Nagash’s tomes so the Liches can claim the power for Settra, King of Kings. First though, there is a Greenskin infestation in the north to deal with…

localised_text.last_approved_text: Settra turns his attention outward and sees a world full of so-called kings, emperors and Lords. These are all pretenders, for there is only one true king, the Great King – the King of Kings. These false sovereigns will yield and will learn who rules and who serves! But first, Settra must dominate Nehekhara once again, and purge it of Greenskin infestations. Let his reign begin…

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Settra turns his attention outward and sees a world full of so-called kings, emperors and Lords. These are all pretenders, for there is only one true king, the Great King – the King of Kings. These false sovereigns will yield and will learn who rules and who serves! But first, Settra must dominate Nehekhara once again, and purge it of Greenskin infestations. Let his reign begin…

localised_text.last_approved_text: Khalida ventures far from Lybaras. Her Liche Priests bring word that Vampires in Lustria seek the books of Nagash to claim the Black Pyramid. The Warrior-Queen cannot brook such a fate and so she has landed on the tip of Lustria, intending to locate the cursed tomes and claim the Pyramid for herself. However, the reptiles infesting this continent do not take kindly to Undead trespassers…

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Khalida ventures far from Lybaras. Her Liche Priests bring word that Vampires in Lustria seek the books of Nagash to claim the Black Pyramid. The Warrior-Queen cannot brook such a fate and so she has landed on the tip of Lustria, intending to locate the cursed tomes and claim the Pyramid for herself. However, the reptiles infesting this continent do not take kindly to Undead trespassers…

localised_text.last_approved_text: Never provoke a serpent – they strike fast and their venom is deadly. But that is the nature of fools and tyrants, to poke and interfere when they should leave well alone. And so High Queen Khalida, Beloved of Asaph, is forced to rise from her throne at the heart of Lybaras, and take her legions to war.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Never provoke a serpent – they strike fast and their venom is deadly. But that is the nature of fools and tyrants, to poke and interfere when they should leave well alone. And so High Queen Khalida, Beloved of Asaph, is forced to rise from her throne at the heart of Lybaras, and take her legions to war.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Great Vortex that swirls at the heart of Ulthuan is vulnerable. Once before Malekith took aim at the Vortex, the repercussions of which caused the Sundering. This time his mother, Morathi, has a plan. Although, she has been banished southwards while her son broods, it matters not; the Hag Sorceress will hunt out the Scrolls of Hekarti needed to enact a ritual that will see her kin dominant.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The Great Vortex that swirls at the heart of Ulthuan is vulnerable. Once before Malekith took aim at the Vortex, the repercussions of which caused the Sundering. This time his mother, Morathi, has a plan. Although, she has been banished southwards while her son broods, it matters not; the Hag Sorceress will hunt out the Scrolls of Hekarti needed to enact a ritual that will see her kin dominant.

localised_text.last_approved_text: For too long the Dark Elves have squatted in their adopted homeland of Naggaroth - it is time that Malekith brought the world under his dominion! From his capital Naggarond, the Witch King shall quickly bring any rebellious Dreadlords to heel and then set about conquering the world. All beings are Malekith’s thralls and slaves, even if they don’t yet know it.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: For too long the Dark Elves have squatted in their adopted homeland of Naggaroth - it is time that Malekith brought the world under his dominion! From his capital Naggarond, the Witch King shall quickly bring any rebellious Dreadlords to heel and then set about conquering the world. All beings are Malekith’s thralls and slaves, even if they don’t yet know it.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Dark clouds gather. In the north, the followers of the Ruinous Powers grow restless. If the Druchii are to be the slave-masters of all, it is time for the Hag Sorceress to act. Morathi’s intrigues are deep and complex; oft-times her schemes run afoul of the Witch King’s own plans. For this, she and her rabid followers have been banished to the Ancient City of Quintex. Let her rivals think this a punishment - it is a move of Morathi’s own design, from where she can work her plans for world domination away from prying eyes.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Dark clouds gather. In the north, the followers of the Ruinous Powers grow restless. If the Druchii are to be the slave-masters of all, it is time for the Hag Sorceress to act. Morathi’s intrigues are deep and complex; oft-times her schemes run afoul of the Witch King’s own plans. For this, she and her rabid followers have been banished to the Ancient City of Quintex. Let her rivals think this a punishment - it is a move of Morathi’s own design, from where she can work her plans for world domination away from prying eyes.
{{tr:loading_screen_campaign_start_malekith}}
{{tr:loading_screen_campaign_start_malekith}}

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Skaven may be as numerous and pervasive as they are vicious and scheming, but they are seldom seen in Naggaroth, and it is rare for them to directly engage a being of such power as Malekith, the Witch King of the Dark Elves.\nNevertheless, the ratmen are loose in Naggarond, and now they threaten to overrun the Dark Elf capital. Malekith must halt the Skaven momentum lest they force a way into his city from below.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The Skaven may be as numerous and pervasive as they are vicious and scheming, but they are seldom seen in Naggaroth, and it is rare for them to directly engage a being of such power as Malekith, the Witch King of the Dark Elves.\nNevertheless, the ratmen are loose in Naggarond, and now they threaten to overrun the Dark Elf capital. Malekith must halt the Skaven momentum lest they force a way into his city from below.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The victorious Druchii secure the battlefield, gleefully butchering any quivering wounded they find. Malekith, for his part, turns his attention to re-securing his capital.\nThe Witch King knows that the Skaven threat will recede only with their complete eradication from the continent!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The victorious Druchii secure the battlefield, gleefully butchering any quivering wounded they find. Malekith, for his part, turns his attention to re-securing his capital.\nThe Witch King knows that the Skaven threat will recede only with their complete eradication from the continent!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The defeated Skaven vermin run squealing before your exultant host, their treacherous attempt to subvert your plan to their own ends crushed utterly. The Vortex lies defenceless before you, the wards guarding it overborne at last by your final ritual. Your iron-shod heels grind the corpses of your defeated foes as you approach the shimmering epicentre of the maelstrom. Here is power, waiting for one with the will to seize it and bend it to his will. Once, millennia ago, you hesitated upon the threshold of greatness, doubt plucking at your shoulder as you prepared to step into the flames and be proclaimed as the Phoenix King. That doubt made you weak, and Asuryan’s wrath almost consumed you. Now though there is no doubt. The power of the Great Vortex is not subject to the whims of any god. You have merely to harness your thirst for vengeance and gather it to yourself to become a rival to the gods. Now is the time, and you seize it, stepping into the well of power and howling in exultation as it courses through your twisted soul. The world and the heavens above it will groan under your eternal dominion!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The defeated Skaven vermin run squealing before your exultant host, their treacherous attempt to subvert your plan to their own ends crushed utterly. The Vortex lies defenceless before you, the wards guarding it overborne at last by your final ritual. Your iron-shod heels grind the corpses of your defeated foes as you approach the shimmering epicentre of the maelstrom. Here is power, waiting for one with the will to seize it and bend it to his will. Once, millennia ago, you hesitated upon the threshold of greatness, doubt plucking at your shoulder as you prepared to step into the flames and be proclaimed as the Phoenix King. That doubt made you weak, and Asuryan’s wrath almost consumed you. Now though there is no doubt. The power of the Great Vortex is not subject to the whims of any god. You have merely to harness your thirst for vengeance and gather it to yourself to become a rival to the gods. Now is the time, and you seize it, stepping into the well of power and howling in exultation as it courses through your twisted soul. The world and the heavens above it will groan under your eternal dominion!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The defeated Skaven vermin run squealing before your exultant host, their treacherous attempt to subvert your plan crushed utterly. The Vortex lies defenceless before you, the wards guarding it overborne at last by your final ritual. Your laughter is a thing of malice and cold triumph. In aeons past you revelled in the violent excesses perpetrated by the Phoenix King Aenarion, your husband. Under your spell, the purity of this god-like lord was subverted and you manipulated him into ever greater follies on the path that eventually led to his doom. Malekith, the son that you made with Aenarion, is another great lord, but like his father he is also a slave to your manipulation. Through the power of the Great Vortex, you will raise him high, but you will be the true power, pulling the strings in the shadows and twisting all to your own ends. With a cruel smile, you beckon him toward the vortex and the power that awaits. And like the puppet he is, the Witch King steps forward to do your bidding.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The defeated Skaven vermin run squealing before your exultant host, their treacherous attempt to subvert your plan crushed utterly. The Vortex lies defenceless before you, the wards guarding it overborne at last by your final ritual. Your laughter is a thing of malice and cold triumph. In aeons past you revelled in the violent excesses perpetrated by the Phoenix King Aenarion, your husband. Under your spell, the purity of this god-like lord was subverted and you manipulated him into ever greater follies on the path that eventually led to his doom. Malekith, the son that you made with Aenarion, is another great lord, but like his father he is also a slave to your manipulation. Through the power of the Great Vortex, you will raise him high, but you will be the true power, pulling the strings in the shadows and twisting all to your own ends. With a cruel smile, you beckon him toward the vortex and the power that awaits. And like the puppet he is, the Witch King steps forward to do your bidding.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Defeated by your heroic legions, the last of the treacherous Skaven host break and run, squealing in terror and thwarted rage, their scheme to subvert your final ritual to their own evil ends thwarted at the last. The Great Vortex hums softly, the sickly hues which had marred its currents dissipating, replaced instead with stronger, purer tones which speak of renewed strength. At the epicentre of the maelstrom, almost obscured by the mounting blaze of illumination, the ancient figure of Caledor slowly unbends, freed at last from his eternal, intolerable task of maintaining the great enchantment. Rising to his full height, he raises his hands and bathes in the light which now enfolds him in its nurturing glow. The light intensifies, and with a final faint smile of release the great Mage transcends, his essence becoming one with the Great Vortex, giving it a golden strength unbreakable.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Defeated by your heroic legions, the last of the treacherous Skaven host break and run, squealing in terror and thwarted rage, their scheme to subvert your final ritual to their own evil ends thwarted at the last. The Great Vortex hums softly, the sickly hues which had marred its currents dissipating, replaced instead with stronger, purer tones which speak of renewed strength. At the epicentre of the maelstrom, almost obscured by the mounting blaze of illumination, the ancient figure of Caledor slowly unbends, freed at last from his eternal, intolerable task of maintaining the great enchantment. Rising to his full height, he raises his hands and bathes in the light which now enfolds him in its nurturing glow. The light intensifies, and with a final faint smile of release the great Mage transcends, his essence becoming one with the Great Vortex, giving it a golden strength unbreakable.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Skaven host, the spawn of treachery, break and run, squealing before your stalwart legions, their schemes defeated utterly. The geomantic web hums with power, channelling the mighty will of the Slann Mage Priests into the Great Vortex. The great enchantment is the Elves’ mightiest work, yet what are they but a servant race? Small wonder that their work was flawed, and that enemies sought to exploit these flaws to imperil the world. All of this was written in the Old Ones’ Great Plan, and it was written too that it would fall to the first servants of the Old Ones, under your guiding hand, to conduct the Great Warding and thus bring order. The geomantic energy envelops the Vortex, correcting its wilder anomalies and anchoring its power for ever. Another step in the Great Plan is completed, and the powers of Chaos howl in fury in the void without.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The Skaven host, the spawn of treachery, break and run, squealing before your stalwart legions, their schemes defeated utterly. The geomantic web hums with power, channelling the mighty will of the Slann Mage Priests into the Great Vortex. The great enchantment is the Elves’ mightiest work, yet what are they but a servant race? Small wonder that their work was flawed, and that enemies sought to exploit these flaws to imperil the world. All of this was written in the Old Ones’ Great Plan, and it was written too that it would fall to the first servants of the Old Ones, under your guiding hand, to conduct the Great Warding and thus bring order. The geomantic energy envelops the Vortex, correcting its wilder anomalies and anchoring its power for ever. Another step in the Great Plan is completed, and the powers of Chaos howl in fury in the void without.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Ha! The treacherous wretches under the command of the Council of Thirteen run squealing before your triumphant horde, the musk of their terror heavy in the air. The attempt to double-cross and steal your glory has failed. The Great Vortex lies defenceless before you, its wards beaten down by the power of your final ritual. All is in place for the coming of the Great Horned Rat. The eternal glory will be yours, and yours alone. All Skavendom will remember your great name, the might of your armies, the subtlety of your schemes, the magnificence of your pelt! You shriek your triumph into the winds howling around the Vortex, and within that faltering construction a great shadowy form moves. Hunched and cloaked, still it towers over all, its horned head turning to survey your cowering servants, its clawed hands reaching for the veil separating it from this world. The Great Horned Rat is come in his full diabolical majesty and you, his favoured servant, wait to greet him and share in his victory.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Ha! The treacherous wretches under the command of the Council of Thirteen run squealing before your triumphant horde, the musk of their terror heavy in the air. The attempt to double-cross and steal your glory has failed. The Great Vortex lies defenceless before you, its wards beaten down by the power of your final ritual. All is in place for the coming of the Great Horned Rat. The eternal glory will be yours, and yours alone. All Skavendom will remember your great name, the might of your armies, the subtlety of your schemes, the magnificence of your pelt! You shriek your triumph into the winds howling around the Vortex, and within that faltering construction a great shadowy form moves. Hunched and cloaked, still it towers over all, its horned head turning to survey your cowering servants, its clawed hands reaching for the veil separating it from this world. The Great Horned Rat is come in his full diabolical majesty and you, his favoured servant, wait to greet him and share in his victory.
{{tr:loading_screen_campaign_start_tyrion}}
{{tr:loading_screen_campaign_start_tyrion}}

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Dark Elves - the Druchii, as they are known amongst the Elven kind - are the mortal enemies of the High Elves, or Asur. A state of bitter war has persisted between the Asur and Druchii for millennia, and no quarter is ever given in the frequent battles between the two.\nTyrion knows that the citizens of Lothern will receive no mercy if it falls to the enemy, and that the meagre force he commands is the best hope of averting the capital's destruction.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The Dark Elves - the Druchii, as they are known amongst the Elven kind - are the mortal enemies of the High Elves, or Asur. A state of bitter war has persisted between the Asur and Druchii for millennia, and no quarter is ever given in the frequent battles between the two.\nTyrion knows that the citizens of Lothern will receive no mercy if it falls to the enemy, and that the meagre force he commands is the best hope of averting the capital's destruction.

localised_text.last_approved_text: News of Tyrion's victory against the Druchii spreads quickly throughout Lothern. The plazas of the capital are filled with scenes of revelry - much to the consternation of the Phoenix court, still on a war footing.\nOut in the field, Tyrion and his forces bandage their wounds and collect the waystones of the dead. Lothern is secure for now, but the need to drive the Druchii out of Ulthuan once and for all remains paramount.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: News of Tyrion's victory against the Druchii spreads quickly throughout Lothern. The plazas of the capital are filled with scenes of revelry - much to the consternation of the Phoenix court, still on a war footing.\nOut in the field, Tyrion and his forces bandage their wounds and collect the waystones of the dead. Lothern is secure for now, but the need to drive the Druchii out of Ulthuan once and for all remains paramount.

localised_text.last_approved_text: While Tyrion remains on Ulthuan to defend its borders, Teclis looks further afield for the answers that may save the Vortex. Accompanied by a host of Loremasters from Saphery, the Archmage begins his search on the west coast of Lustria. Way-fragments are needed to power the Ritual of Prophecy that may lead to the world’s salvation.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: While Tyrion remains on Ulthuan to defend its borders, Teclis looks further afield for the answers that may save the Vortex. Accompanied by a host of Loremasters from Saphery, the Archmage begins his search on the west coast of Lustria. Way-fragments are needed to power the Ritual of Prophecy that may lead to the world’s salvation.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Teclis is considered by many to be the world’s greatest hope against the predations of Chaos. He has once more travelled beyond his homeland's borders, this time to seek answers at the Star Tower on Lustria's eastern coast. Teclis' hopes of locating his followers and being left in peace are soon dashed, as others consider the High Loremaster’s seclusion a dire threat to their own plans. Reluctantly, it seems Teclis must fight to save the world.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Teclis is considered by many to be the world’s greatest hope against the predations of Chaos. He has once more travelled beyond his homeland's borders, this time to seek answers at the Star Tower on Lustria's eastern coast. Teclis' hopes of locating his followers and being left in peace are soon dashed, as others consider the High Loremaster’s seclusion a dire threat to their own plans. Reluctantly, it seems Teclis must fight to save the world.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The High Elves - the Asur - are no strangers to war. Although they would prefer to live in peace, the other petty and infuriating races seem destined to tread the path of wanton bloodlust. Even if this was not so, there is a dire threat growing in the north. It is clear that the Asur can no longer ignore goings-on beyond Ulthuan’s shores. The Phoenix King has entrusted Prince Tyrion - the war council's leader - to unify Ulthuan and bring the world under High Elf protection.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The High Elves - the Asur - are no strangers to war. Although they would prefer to live in peace, the other petty and infuriating races seem destined to tread the path of wanton bloodlust. Even if this was not so, there is a dire threat growing in the north. It is clear that the Asur can no longer ignore goings-on beyond Ulthuan’s shores. The Phoenix King has entrusted Prince Tyrion - the war council's leader - to unify Ulthuan and bring the world under High Elf protection.
{{tr:loading_screen_campaign_start_mazdamundi}}
{{tr:loading_screen_campaign_start_mazdamundi}}

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Norse have maintained a colony on the Lustrian coast for generations. Raids against Lizardmen temple-cities are not uncommon, for the golden riches within make for tempting, if frequently lethal, prizes.\nYet never before have the Northmen invaded in such number, nor have they penetrated so deep into the Lustrian interior. Lord Mazdamundi, the eldest, most warlike of all remaining Slann Mage-Priests, is compelled to act.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The Norse have maintained a colony on the Lustrian coast for generations. Raids against Lizardmen temple-cities are not uncommon, for the golden riches within make for tempting, if frequently lethal, prizes.\nYet never before have the Northmen invaded in such number, nor have they penetrated so deep into the Lustrian interior. Lord Mazdamundi, the eldest, most warlike of all remaining Slann Mage-Priests, is compelled to act.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The defeated Norse scatter into the jungle, chased by talon and claw alike. Lord Mazdamundi soon halts the pursuit, knowing that in time the deadly jungles will exact their own terrible price on the wounded invaders.\nHis attention has already turned to the reclamation of those other Lizardmen temple-cities still under warmblood occupation, and to the further task of driving all trespassers out of Lustria permanently.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The defeated Norse scatter into the jungle, chased by talon and claw alike. Lord Mazdamundi soon halts the pursuit, knowing that in time the deadly jungles will exact their own terrible price on the wounded invaders.\nHis attention has already turned to the reclamation of those other Lizardmen temple-cities still under warmblood occupation, and to the further task of driving all trespassers out of Lustria permanently.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Lord Mazdamundi, most powerful of all living Mage-Priests, has decreed that the time for inaction is over. While the followers of the Ancient Enemy muster in the far north, Hexoatl must wage war upon all - both warm and cold-blooded - who bring discordance to Mazdamundi’s interpretation of the Great Plan. The younger races have squandered the Old Ones' bounty; now Order shall be forced upon them, while the other abominations face naught but obliteration!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Lord Mazdamundi, most powerful of all living Mage-Priests, has decreed that the time for inaction is over. While the followers of the Ancient Enemy muster in the far north, Hexoatl must wage war upon all - both warm and cold-blooded - who bring discordance to Mazdamundi’s interpretation of the Great Plan. The younger races have squandered the Old Ones' bounty; now Order shall be forced upon them, while the other abominations face naught but obliteration!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Lord Mazdamundi has sent the fearsome Kroq-Gar across the world pond to the Southlands. In this far flung continent, the Last Defender of Xhotl will establish a new power base to enact the next stage of Great Plan and hunt out the Sacred Plaques that shall power the Ritual of Prognostication.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Lord Mazdamundi has sent the fearsome Kroq-Gar across the world pond to the Southlands. In this far flung continent, the Last Defender of Xhotl will establish a new power base to enact the next stage of Great Plan and hunt out the Sacred Plaques that shall power the Ritual of Prognostication.

localised_text.last_approved_text: An age of eternal war is approaching. For the Last Defender of Xhotl and his loyal followers, such a time holds no fear. Kroq-Gar is an ancient Scar-Leader who has killed countless enemies - a tally that is about to drastically increase. Sent across the World Pond by Lord Mazdamundi, Kroq-Gar’s task is simple - he must strengthen the degrading Geomantic Web and eradicate all those discordant to the Great Plan. He begins at the Temple of Skulls where, no doubt, more skulls will soon be offered!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: An age of eternal war is approaching. For the Last Defender of Xhotl and his loyal followers, such a time holds no fear. Kroq-Gar is an ancient Scar-Leader who has killed countless enemies - a tally that is about to drastically increase. Sent across the World Pond by Lord Mazdamundi, Kroq-Gar’s task is simple - he must strengthen the degrading Geomantic Web and eradicate all those discordant to the Great Plan. He begins at the Temple of Skulls where, no doubt, more skulls will soon be offered!
{{tr:loading_screen_campaign_start_queek}}
{{tr:loading_screen_campaign_start_queek}}

localised_text.last_approved_text: Off the Southlands coast, the High Elf Fortress of Dawn has stood sentinel against both elements and enemies for over a millennium. In all that time, the Asur have never shown much interest in colonising the interior of the continent. Yet something has changed, and they now threaten the Skaven warren beneath the ruined city of Yuatek.\nQueek Headtaker, the most ambitious, aggressive and bloodthirsty of all Skaven warlords, moves to engage.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Off the Southlands coast, the High Elf Fortress of Dawn has stood sentinel against both elements and enemies for over a millennium. In all that time, the Asur have never shown much interest in colonising the interior of the continent. Yet something has changed, and they now threaten the Skaven warren beneath the ruined city of Yuatek.\nQueek Headtaker, the most ambitious, aggressive and bloodthirsty of all Skaven warlords, moves to engage.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The luckiest Elves are those slain in the battle. The wounded are consumed alive where they lie, while those that flee are effortlessly overtaken by Skaven runners, surrounded, and brought back as captives.\nThe Headtaker, for his part, has already turned his attention towards the Elf-thing forts in the province. The Asur are a proud race, and will surely seek to avenge their defeat. Queek will strike first-first!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The luckiest Elves are those slain in the battle. The wounded are consumed alive where they lie, while those that flee are effortlessly overtaken by Skaven runners, surrounded, and brought back as captives.\nThe Headtaker, for his part, has already turned his attention towards the Elf-thing forts in the province. The Asur are a proud race, and will surely seek to avenge their defeat. Queek will strike first-first!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Clan Mors is ascendant! The most powerful clan of all is poised to execute its plan for total supremacy. In Skavenblight, Grand Warlord Gnawdwell makes his move, through fragile political alliances and flagrant assassination. Meanwhile, he sends his Right Paw, Queek Headtaker, to Karag Orrud, to bring all races under Mors' yoke. The slave tally will be great! Of course, if Queek fights all the battles and claims all the ruins, why should he be content merely to be Gnawdwell's servant? Surely, the title 'Warlord of all Skavendom' awaits the Headtaker?

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Clan Mors is ascendant! The most powerful clan of all is poised to execute its plan for total supremacy. In Skavenblight, Grand Warlord Gnawdwell makes his move, through fragile political alliances and flagrant assassination. Meanwhile, he sends his Right Paw, Queek Headtaker, to Karag Orrud, to bring all races under Mors' yoke. The slave tally will be great! Of course, if Queek fights all the battles and claims all the ruins, why should he be content merely to be Gnawdwell's servant? Surely, the title 'Warlord of all Skavendom' awaits the Headtaker?

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Grey Seer, Vulscreek, with the Council’s backing, has demanded that Lord Skrolk take Lustria for Clan Pestilens once more. As well as bringing the jungle continent under the sway of the Skaven, Skrolk must harvest Warpstone to power the rituals that will give him control of the Elf-things' faltering Vortex.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The Grey Seer, Vulscreek, with the Council’s backing, has demanded that Lord Skrolk take Lustria for Clan Pestilens once more. As well as bringing the jungle continent under the sway of the Skaven, Skrolk must harvest Warpstone to power the rituals that will give him control of the Elf-things' faltering Vortex.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Sotek is weak. While the Lizardmen's Serpent God may have expelled Pestilens from Lustria, the infestation always returns… Under the orders of Arch-Plaguelord Nurglitch, Lord Skrolk shall infect Lustria once more. Starting in Oyxl, Clan Pestilens will spread their plagues throughout the jungle continent. But why stop there? The world is full of ripe bodies ready for infection. And, as he grows in power, as Clan Pestilens becomes the most powerful faction in the Under-Empire, even Nurglitch will bow to Skrolk!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Sotek is weak. While the Lizardmen's Serpent God may have expelled Pestilens from Lustria, the infestation always returns… Under the orders of Arch-Plaguelord Nurglitch, Lord Skrolk shall infect Lustria once more. Starting in Oyxl, Clan Pestilens will spread their plagues throughout the jungle continent. But why stop there? The world is full of ripe bodies ready for infection. And, as he grows in power, as Clan Pestilens becomes the most powerful faction in the Under-Empire, even Nurglitch will bow to Skrolk!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Chaos Moon looms across the sky. It is a dark omen, a demand from the Ruinous Powers that the Cloven Ones rise up! They must emerge from their forest lairs and tear down the trappings of civilisation. Now is the Time of the Beast, and the Elector Counts - those of Todbringer's ilk - will pay in blood and the obliteration of their precious cities. And so the beast-path to destruction is paved with the bodies of men, of Dwarfs, and of Greenskins.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The Chaos Moon looms across the sky. It is a dark omen, a demand from the Ruinous Powers that the Cloven Ones rise up! They must emerge from their forest lairs and tear down the trappings of civilisation. Now is the Time of the Beast, and the Elector Counts - those of Todbringer's ilk - will pay in blood and the obliteration of their precious cities. And so the beast-path to destruction is paved with the bodies of men, of Dwarfs, and of Greenskins.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Chaos Moon looms across the sky. It is a dark omen, a demand from the Ruinous Powers that the Cloven Ones rise up! The Despoiler of the Sacred himself, Malagor, has made it to the long-ruined city of Mourkain, deep in the Badlands. He revels in its ruins, a glorious reminder of a sundered civilisation for those who would follow him, and what will come to pass should Malagor's desires be fulfilled. So begins the Crowfather's destructive path - something wicked is coming...

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The Chaos Moon looms across the sky. It is a dark omen, a demand from the Ruinous Powers that the Cloven Ones rise up! The Despoiler of the Sacred himself, Malagor, has made it to the long-ruined city of Mourkain, deep in the Badlands. He revels in its ruins, a glorious reminder of a sundered civilisation for those who would follow him, and what will come to pass should Malagor's desires be fulfilled. So begins the Crowfather's destructive path - something wicked is coming...

localised_text.last_approved_text: Revered by the Beastmen, but reviled by his enemies, Morghur the Shadowgave is more than a little difficult to kill. If the twisted Beastlord's body is cut down, he is simply reborn elsewhere, draws a bray-herd to him, and the whole Ruinous cycle of madness and destruction begins anew. Only Queen Ariel of the Wood Elves truly understands that Morghur's evil is simply too powerful to be contained within a single corporeal form, and seeks a way to bring about his permanent destruction. Morghur cares not of this plan, for he seeks the very same for Athel Loren!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Revered by the Beastmen, but reviled by his enemies, Morghur the Shadowgave is more than a little difficult to kill. If the twisted Beastlord's body is cut down, he is simply reborn elsewhere, draws a bray-herd to him, and the whole Ruinous cycle of madness and destruction begins anew. Only Queen Ariel of the Wood Elves truly understands that Morghur's evil is simply too powerful to be contained within a single corporeal form, and seeks a way to bring about his permanent destruction. Morghur cares not of this plan, for he seeks the very same for Athel Loren!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The newly-crowned Emperor, Karl Franz, has freed the beleaguered city of Altdorf from the predations of the Greenskins, but the capital is still in turmoil and the Emperor must remain to stabilise the city. He has tasked his strongest ally and leader of the Cult of Sigmar - Volkmar the Grim - to deal with the backlash from his successful election. Volkmar must now act against secessionists to the south and Ulric’s agitant supporters in the province of Middenland. Faith and fury will be required!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The newly-crowned Emperor, Karl Franz, has freed the beleaguered city of Altdorf from the predations of the Greenskins, but the capital is still in turmoil and the Emperor must remain to stabilise the city. He has tasked his strongest ally and leader of the Cult of Sigmar - Volkmar the Grim - to deal with the backlash from his successful election. Volkmar must now act against secessionists to the south and Ulric’s agitant supporters in the province of Middenland. Faith and fury will be required!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Mannfred von Carstein has revealed himself to the world once more. His first act was to retake the ancestral home of his bloodline, Drakenhof, and drive from it the hapless Necromancer, Zelig van Kruger. With his capital secure, Mannfred has retreated deep into the vaults to seek out lost lore and make dread plans. He has tasked his faithful servant, the Necromancer Helman Ghorst, to prepare Sylvania and beyond for his coming...

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Mannfred von Carstein has revealed himself to the world once more. His first act was to retake the ancestral home of his bloodline, Drakenhof, and drive from it the hapless Necromancer, Zelig van Kruger. With his capital secure, Mannfred has retreated deep into the vaults to seek out lost lore and make dread plans. He has tasked his faithful servant, the Necromancer Helman Ghorst, to prepare Sylvania and beyond for his coming...

localised_text.last_approved_text: In times past, Durthu bound the forest spirits of Athel Loren with those of the Wood Elves. For a while, he considered the alliance to be a positive force, but that was before great swathes of the forest were cut down, before the Elves invited calamity to befall Athel Loren. Now, Durthu's wrath is great; the Asrai are only spared its lashing tendrils for reasons of expediency in defeating the threat now facing the forest.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: In times past, Durthu bound the forest spirits of Athel Loren with those of the Wood Elves. For a while, he considered the alliance to be a positive force, but that was before great swathes of the forest were cut down, before the Elves invited calamity to befall Athel Loren. Now, Durthu's wrath is great; the Asrai are only spared its lashing tendrils for reasons of expediency in defeating the threat now facing the forest.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Each year, Orion dies symbolically upon a funeral pyre in the heart of his forest kingdom, only to be reborn anew the following year. Immediately, the Wild Hunt begins; the forest spirits range through its glades, bonding Athel Loren's various flora and fauna together in harmony once more. Should the forest be threatened, Orion is always the first to stand in its defence and smite those responsible.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Each year, Orion dies symbolically upon a funeral pyre in the heart of his forest kingdom, only to be reborn anew the following year. Immediately, the Wild Hunt begins; the forest spirits range through its glades, bonding Athel Loren's various flora and fauna together in harmony once more. Should the forest be threatened, Orion is always the first to stand in its defence and smite those responsible.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Belegar Ironhammer is a king in exile. Thrice before he has attempted to retake Karak Eight Peaks but been thwarted, his last expedition failing due to the machinations of a particularly-cunning Night Goblin Warlord. But now, after decades of preparation, he is ready to try once more. A call to Clan is sent and the throngs of Clan Angrund gather at the loyal Hold of Karak Izor, ready for battle.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Belegar Ironhammer is a king in exile. Thrice before he has attempted to retake Karak Eight Peaks but been thwarted, his last expedition failing due to the machinations of a particularly-cunning Night Goblin Warlord. But now, after decades of preparation, he is ready to try once more. A call to Clan is sent and the throngs of Clan Angrund gather at the loyal Hold of Karak Izor, ready for battle.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Skarsnik has been tempted away from the Eight Peaks on a hunting expedition to the old stunty Hold of Karak Azgaraz, looking for a rare breed of Cave Squigs. As Skarsnik and his most loyal ladz capture the Squigs, word reaches him that an Orc Boss has taken over in his absence, proclaiming himself the new Warlord of the Eight Peaks! Instead of outrage, Skarsnik smiles a long, devious smile. At last! A challenge...

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Skarsnik has been tempted away from the Eight Peaks on a hunting expedition to the old stunty Hold of Karak Azgaraz, looking for a rare breed of Cave Squigs. As Skarsnik and his most loyal ladz capture the Squigs, word reaches him that an Orc Boss has taken over in his absence, proclaiming himself the new Warlord of the Eight Peaks! Instead of outrage, Skarsnik smiles a long, devious smile. At last! A challenge...

localised_text.last_approved_text: Grimgor Ironhide has taken Black Crag, and many Orcs flock to the Black Orc’s banner. Now Wurrzag, 'Da Great Green Prophet', comes, declaring Ironhide chosen by Mork and Gork - the Great Green Godz themselves. Grimgor, for his part, tolerates Wurrzag up to a point, but cannot stand the Savage Orc’s constant "mumbo-jumbo". As such, he has sent him off to Ekrund to aid the beleaguered Orcs of the Bloody Handz.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Grimgor Ironhide has taken Black Crag, and many Orcs flock to the Black Orc’s banner. Now Wurrzag, 'Da Great Green Prophet', comes, declaring Ironhide chosen by Mork and Gork - the Great Green Godz themselves. Grimgor, for his part, tolerates Wurrzag up to a point, but cannot stand the Savage Orc’s constant "mumbo-jumbo". As such, he has sent him off to Ekrund to aid the beleaguered Orcs of the Bloody Handz.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The enemies of Duke Alberic of Bordeleaux are correct to shrink and run from his presence, for he is a mighty opponent – a Knight almost without equal who has never been bested on the field of battle by mortal adversary or unenchanted blade. As one of Bretonnia’s greatest exponents of lance and sword, he has on many occasions stood shoulder to shoulder with King Louen, facing down the forces of evil wherever they may be found in the name of his patron-god, Manann, and the Lady of the Lake!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The enemies of Duke Alberic of Bordeleaux are correct to shrink and run from his presence, for he is a mighty opponent – a Knight almost without equal who has never been bested on the field of battle by mortal adversary or unenchanted blade. As one of Bretonnia’s greatest exponents of lance and sword, he has on many occasions stood shoulder to shoulder with King Louen, facing down the forces of evil wherever they may be found in the name of his patron-god, Manann, and the Lady of the Lake!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Vampires, Greenskins and Beastmen alike are right to run from the field when King Louen Leoncoeur – ‘the Lionhearted’ – charges into the fray atop his noble Hippogryph Beaquis, for their doom is surely at hand! Wearing the blessed Crown of Bretonnia, and wielding the legendary Sword of Couronne – forged from exquisite Bretonnian silverine – the recently-crowned King Louen comes to smite evil from his lands with the eternal blessing of the Lady of the Lake!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Vampires, Greenskins and Beastmen alike are right to run from the field when King Louen Leoncoeur – ‘the Lionhearted’ – charges into the fray atop his noble Hippogryph Beaquis, for their doom is surely at hand! Wearing the blessed Crown of Bretonnia, and wielding the legendary Sword of Couronne – forged from exquisite Bretonnian silverine – the recently-crowned King Louen comes to smite evil from his lands with the eternal blessing of the Lady of the Lake!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Foes of all races, and even her own loyal Bretonnians, live in fear of the Fay Enchantress. A sorceress of great repute, she uses her magical powers to channel the Lady, identifying threats to the Kingdom and martialling its forces to face them. In battle, she rides Silvaron, her loyal Unicorn into the fray, using her magic to defend and protect the Knights whilst also striking down enemies with a withering stare from her cold, furious eyes!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Foes of all races, and even her own loyal Bretonnians, live in fear of the Fay Enchantress. A sorceress of great repute, she uses her magical powers to channel the Lady, identifying threats to the Kingdom and martialling its forces to face them. In battle, she rides Silvaron, her loyal Unicorn into the fray, using her magic to defend and protect the Knights whilst also striking down enemies with a withering stare from her cold, furious eyes!

localised_text.last_approved_text: Time is meaningless within the Realm of Chaos. Has Archaon completed his Unholy Quests or just begun his infernal journey? It matters not to him, for he is the Everchosen, and is destined to bring the End Times to the mortal fools that eke out their pitiful lives in the south. They will all pay; the price is blood, slaughter and death!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Time is meaningless within the Realm of Chaos. Has Archaon completed his Unholy Quests or just begun his infernal journey? It matters not to him, for he is the Everchosen, and is destined to bring the End Times to the mortal fools that eke out their pitiful lives in the south. They will all pay; the price is blood, slaughter and death!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The storms gather, raging across the north, rousing the oldest of Shaggoths. Kholek has awoken and his anger is as fierce as he is ancient. Now is the time to honour the ancient pact made with the Chaos Gods – to wage endless war. For Kholek Suneater is no mere minion of the Ruinous Powers, but the Herald of the Tempest.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The storms gather, raging across the north, rousing the oldest of Shaggoths. Kholek has awoken and his anger is as fierce as he is ancient. Now is the time to honour the ancient pact made with the Chaos Gods – to wage endless war. For Kholek Suneater is no mere minion of the Ruinous Powers, but the Herald of the Tempest.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Dark Prince calls to his step-child, demanding that the Geld-Prince chastise the southern lands. The summons is timely, for he grows bored of subjugating the marauder tribes of the steppes and northern wastes - it is time for Sigvald the Magnificent to revel in bloody glory across the Old World!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The Dark Prince calls to his step-child, demanding that the Geld-Prince chastise the southern lands. The summons is timely, for he grows bored of subjugating the marauder tribes of the steppes and northern wastes - it is time for Sigvald the Magnificent to revel in bloody glory across the Old World!

localised_text.last_approved_text: On a visit to Karaz-a-Karak, the White Dwarf witnessed Thorgrim vanquish the Greenskins that dared skulk in the shadow of Everpeak. The Orcs of the Bloody Spears were routed, with many sent scurrying into the Pillars of Grungni. Whilst witnessing the events, Grombrindal had remained incognito, but at this outrage he revealed himself to the High King, pledging to take a throng of willing Dawi and recapture the sacred site.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: On a visit to Karaz-a-Karak, the White Dwarf witnessed Thorgrim vanquish the Greenskins that dared skulk in the shadow of Everpeak. The Orcs of the Bloody Spears were routed, with many sent scurrying into the Pillars of Grungni. Whilst witnessing the events, Grombrindal had remained incognito, but at this outrage he revealed himself to the High King, pledging to take a throng of willing Dawi and recapture the sacred site.

localised_text.last_approved_text: It is a dark time in Thorgrim Grudgebearer's reign. Despite convincing his kin not to seal their Holds and diminish, their enemies are emboldened. Greenskins gathered in the shade of Everpeak. Thorgrim could not let that stand and so marched forth and slew them. But the remnants fled and now skulk in the sacred site of Grungni's Pillars. Another grudge recorded; another that needs to be settled if the Age of Reckoning is to continue!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: It is a dark time in Thorgrim Grudgebearer's reign. Despite convincing his kin not to seal their Holds and diminish, their enemies are emboldened. Greenskins gathered in the shade of Everpeak. Thorgrim could not let that stand and so marched forth and slew them. But the remnants fled and now skulk in the sacred site of Grungni's Pillars. Another grudge recorded; another that needs to be settled if the Age of Reckoning is to continue!

localised_text.last_approved_text: While visiting his liege in Karaz-a-Karak, the Slayer King witnessed Thorgrim and his mighty throng vanquishing Orc and Goblin filth that trespassed within sight of Everpeak itself. The Greenskins of the Bloody Spearz were vanquished, but many fled into the Pillars of Grungni, another outrage! The two kings agreed that while Thorgrim returned to the Dwarf capital to call the Clans, Ungrim would make ready for war!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: While visiting his liege in Karaz-a-Karak, the Slayer King witnessed Thorgrim and his mighty throng vanquishing Orc and Goblin filth that trespassed within sight of Everpeak itself. The Greenskins of the Bloody Spearz were vanquished, but many fled into the Pillars of Grungni, another outrage! The two kings agreed that while Thorgrim returned to the Dwarf capital to call the Clans, Ungrim would make ready for war!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The powerful Gold Wizard, Balthasar Gelt, has thrown in his lot with the newly-crowned Emperor, Karl Franz. Having freed a beleaguered Altdorf from Greenskins, Gelt finds the Emperor's court already in the midst of politicking - Middenheim is unhappy with the election result and secessionists in the south have rebelled against the Emperor’s rule. While Franz strengthens his position in court, Gelt looks to stabilise the Empire through might and magic.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The powerful Gold Wizard, Balthasar Gelt, has thrown in his lot with the newly-crowned Emperor, Karl Franz. Having freed a beleaguered Altdorf from Greenskins, Gelt finds the Emperor's court already in the midst of politicking - Middenheim is unhappy with the election result and secessionists in the south have rebelled against the Emperor’s rule. While Franz strengthens his position in court, Gelt looks to stabilise the Empire through might and magic.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The newly-crowned Emperor returned from a tour of Reikland to find his capital, Altdorf, besieged by spider-riding Greenskins. Having seen off the Goblin threat, Franz arrives in his court to find the politicking of the Empire already at its height - Middenheim grumbles, and to the south a secessionist rebellion is in full flow. Franz must tread carefully, a wrong move now could split the Empire asunder before his rule has truly begun.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The newly-crowned Emperor returned from a tour of Reikland to find his capital, Altdorf, besieged by spider-riding Greenskins. Having seen off the Goblin threat, Franz arrives in his court to find the politicking of the Empire already at its height - Middenheim grumbles, and to the south a secessionist rebellion is in full flow. Franz must tread carefully, a wrong move now could split the Empire asunder before his rule has truly begun.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Not for the final time, Azhag has been lured south. The promise of battle and the mincing of Stunties is a clarion call. He treads in the aftermath of Black Orc, Grimgor Ironhide, who has been charging towards Black Crag to vanquish rival Warboss, Gorfang Rotgut. It doesn't take long for Grimgor to give Gorfang a big slap. Now the former Boss of Black Crag skulks in Iron Rock, and with the tribes in disarray it is the time for Azhag to make his own mark.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Not for the final time, Azhag has been lured south. The promise of battle and the mincing of Stunties is a clarion call. He treads in the aftermath of Black Orc, Grimgor Ironhide, who has been charging towards Black Crag to vanquish rival Warboss, Gorfang Rotgut. It doesn't take long for Grimgor to give Gorfang a big slap. Now the former Boss of Black Crag skulks in Iron Rock, and with the tribes in disarray it is the time for Azhag to make his own mark.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Grimgor Ironhide could not let an insult stand! Gorfang Rotgut, master of Black Crag, had been slagging him off. So the Black Orc, bored with slaying things under Red Eye Mountain anyway, strode through the World's Edge Mountains killing many stunties as he went. It didn't take him long to deal with Rotgut, although the cur fled and has sworn revenge. Now Grimgor finds himself as Boss of Black Crag with the whole of the Badlands ripe for plunder!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Grimgor Ironhide could not let an insult stand! Gorfang Rotgut, master of Black Crag, had been slagging him off. So the Black Orc, bored with slaying things under Red Eye Mountain anyway, strode through the World's Edge Mountains killing many stunties as he went. It didn't take him long to deal with Rotgut, although the cur fled and has sworn revenge. Now Grimgor finds himself as Boss of Black Crag with the whole of the Badlands ripe for plunder!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Midnight Aristocracy have returned and recaptured their former stronghold at Drakenhof. Content to plot within their keep, the von Carsteins have dispatched the Lichemaster, Heinrich Kemmler, into the world at the head of a ghoulish host. A Necromancer of unrivalled expertise, Kemmler's mastery over the Undead will strike terror into those who face him.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The Midnight Aristocracy have returned and recaptured their former stronghold at Drakenhof. Content to plot within their keep, the von Carsteins have dispatched the Lichemaster, Heinrich Kemmler, into the world at the head of a ghoulish host. A Necromancer of unrivalled expertise, Kemmler's mastery over the Undead will strike terror into those who face him.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Mannfred von Carstein has risen again, and his power and agency over the Undead remain as strong as ever. Binding a host of resurrected horrors to his will, Mannfred has marched against his former keep at Drakenhof and driven from it the hapless Necromancer, Zelig van Kruger. With the ancestral home of the Midnight Aristocracy secure, Mannfred can look to extend his dark reach abroad.

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: Mannfred von Carstein has risen again, and his power and agency over the Undead remain as strong as ever. Binding a host of resurrected horrors to his will, Mannfred has marched against his former keep at Drakenhof and driven from it the hapless Necromancer, Zelig van Kruger. With the ancestral home of the Midnight Aristocracy secure, Mannfred can look to extend his dark reach abroad.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The living won’t stand a chance now that the cold, terrible beauty has taken the field. Isabella von Carstein supports her Unliving husband, the fearsome Vlad, in battle, combining the healing power of the Blood Chalice of Bathori with the merciless swordplay of the classically-schooled warrior to deadly effect. Together, they will seize control of Castle Drakenhof from Mannfred’s grasp before turning their nefarious attentions to a singular goal – becoming Emperor and Empress Eternal!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: The living won’t stand a chance now that the cold, terrible beauty has taken the field. Isabella von Carstein supports her Unliving husband, the fearsome Vlad, in battle, combining the healing power of the Blood Chalice of Bathori with the merciless swordplay of the classically-schooled warrior to deadly effect. Together, they will seize control of Castle Drakenhof from Mannfred’s grasp before turning their nefarious attentions to a singular goal – becoming Emperor and Empress Eternal!

localised_text.last_approved_text: It is a time of woe for those that suffer the curse of living, as the two most powerful of the von Carsteins have been resurrected. Yet for once they are not at war with each other… as yet. But the night is very definitely still young; both Vlad and Mannfred vie for possession of Castle Drakenhof, so now the Midnight Aristocracy’s reign of terror is doubled! First Sylvania will be secured, with the mortal lands to swiftly follow!

custom_loading_screen_components.localised_text: It is a time of woe for those that suffer the curse of living, as the two most powerful of the von Carsteins have been resurrected. Yet for once they are not at war with each other… as yet. But the night is very definitely still young; both Vlad and Mannfred vie for possession of Castle Drakenhof, so now the Midnight Aristocracy’s reign of terror is doubled! First Sylvania will be secured, with the mortal lands to swiftly follow!
